definition: to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
see 的士[di1 shi4]
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
aim/clear
really and truly
to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
arrow/dart/straight/to vow/to swear/old variant of 屎[shi3]

sentences.english: In other words, their goal in learning intonation is not clearly defined.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说，他们在语调学习上处于无的放矢的状态。

sentences.english: When revising you need clear targets – never be aimless.
sentences.chinese: 复习时要目标明确，决不能无的放矢。

sentences.english: The author who composed them must have created them intentionally.
sentences.chinese: 创作它们的作者，本来不可能是在无的放矢。

to make empty promises
